intro: Pyrrhopappus hochstetteri, commonly known as the Hochstetter's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Pyrrhopappus hochstetteri is adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and is often found in coastal and inland regions.
